intro: Ixora obanensis, commonly known as the Oban ixora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. Ixora obanensis thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. It is often cultivated as a decorative shrub in gardens and landscapes due to its vibrant floral display.
